official-title.#text:
To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide for the
		  national collection of data on stillbirths in a standardized manner, and for
		  other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
)
			 introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Stillbirth Awareness and Research Act
			 of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Part B of
			 title III of the Public Health Service Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall, by grant or contract, establish and maintain a
				scientific registry of stillbirths in the United States (in this section
				referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the Centers for Disease
				Control and Prevention

text.#text:
The
				purposes of the registry are—

to provide a
				national repository for reporting and maintaining in a consistent manner data
				on stillbirths; and

to make such data
				available for research on the causes and prevention of stillbirths.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall require States to use the standard
				definition of stillbirth and the standard protocol for stillbirth data
				collection and surveillance as determined pursuant to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the Centers for
				Disease Control and Prevention

text.#text:
The registry shall include, with respect to
				each stillbirth, information on the stillborn fetus and the mother’s health and
				pregnancy as collected and submitted by States on the U.S. Standard Report of
				Fetal Death. In submitting such information, the

header.#text:
Determination of
				standard stillbirth definition and protocol

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide for the development of the
				following:

text.#text:
For purposes of this
				section, the

A standard
				protocol for stillbirth data collection and surveillance.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall ensure that the standard definition and protocol described in

are developed under such paragraph in a manner that ensures the
				consultation of representatives of health care organizations, State and local
				governments, and other interested entities specified by the

should increase the allocation of
			 funds and other resources for stillbirth research.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the National Institutes of Health

text.#text: It is the sense of the

header.#text:
Sense of Congress
			 on NIH funding for stillbirth research

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall carry out a national campaign to increase
			 public awareness and knowledge of stillbirths and public and State awareness of
			 the standard stillbirth definition and standard protocol for stillbirth data
			 collection and surveillance under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Secretary of

section 317U of the Public Health Service
			 Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Stillbirth Awareness and Research Act of 2013/s:2
Stillbirth Awareness and Research Act of 2013/s:4/ss:a

text.#text:
Activities under the national campaign
			 under

header.#text:
Measures To
			 reduce the incidence of stillbirths

text.#text:
the dissemination of information on good
			 prenatal care practices such as not drinking alcohol or smoking; and

the promotion of the use of proactive steps
			 to monitor (or ascertain) a baby’s well-being, including the monitoring of
			 fetal movement beginning at approximately 28 weeks into the pregnancy.
